Holiday Inn Resorts across Southeast Asia and the Maldives offering up to 35% off Published on : Tuesday, July 21, 2015
Holiday Inn® Resorts are making beach-side getaways even more manageable for families and groups of friends, with up to 35% off room rates at its resorts across Southeast Asia and the Maldives, for stays until 19 December 2015.
Guests can enjoy a break with up to 30% off room rates including breakfast, with IHG Rewards Club members receiving an additional 5% off. With the discounted rates available at resorts across Thailand, Indonesia and the Maldives, families can enjoy plenty of time together during a sun and sand-filled getaway. On top of that the Holiday Inn brand’s signature ‘Kids Stay & Eat Free’ programme provides even more value for families taking a well-earned break.
There are Holiday Inn Resorts in a variety of popular holiday destinations around the region boasting incredible settings including:
Resorts in Phuket
Phuket’s pure blue seas and stunning sunsets will always be a favourite for a beach-side getaway. At Holiday Inn Resort Mai Khao Beach families can take a stroll by the beach before diving into some traditional batik painting followed by a lesson on making delicious Thai desserts. Holiday Inn Resort Phuket Patong features a number of large swimming pools across the resort, including family and toddler pools.
Getting there: Tourists travelling from India can fly to Phuket on Thai Airways and Jet Airways to reach Phuket via Suvarnabhumi Airport in Bangkok.
Resorts in the Maldives
The Maldives aren’t just a honeymoon destination. Kandooma island is home to Holiday Inn Resort Kandooma Maldives and lies just 35km south of Male International Airport, which is a 40 minute speedboat ride away. The resort organises activities such as dolphin and sunset cruises as well as snorkelling at beautiful reef sites such as Turtle Point. Kids can hang out at the new Kandooma Kids Club that features 500 square metres of indoor and outdoor entertainment space or enjoy a surf camp with trained instructors.
Getting there: Airlines such as SpiceJet, Air India, Jet Airways and SriLankan Airways all connect cities across India with Male International Airport.
Resorts in Bali
One of Indonesia’s most well-known tourist destinations is Bali, for good reason – it’s an island with a thriving and vibrant culture, beautiful scenery and some of the best beaches in the world. The beach-front Holiday Inn Resort Baruna Bali boasts an abundance of options for kids with a range of great programmes, from cooking classes to water sports. Its sister property, Holiday Inn Resort Bali Benoa, opened in April 2015 and is located directly on Tanjung Beach, known for being one of the most family-friendly beaches for its calm surf.
Getting there: Malaysia Airlines, Thai Airways and Jet Airways all offer stopover flights between cities in India and Bali, with a travel time of approximately 11 hours. Both resorts are close to the airport making the commute very convenient.
To explore Holiday Inn Resorts in the region and book your stay, visit: www.ihg.com/resortsoffer
Holiday Inn is one of the fastest growing hotel brands in the world, with 87 hotels and 20,082 rooms open across the Asia, Middle East and Africa (AMEA) region and a further 50 properties in the development pipeline in AMEA. Globally there are 1,200 Holiday Inn properties open and 267 properties due to open within the next three to five years.
IHG Rewards Club, the industry’s first and largest hotel rewards program with more than 86 million members is free and guests can join at IHGRewardsClub.com, by downloading the IHG® app or by inquiring at the front desk of any of IHG’s more than 4,900 hotels worldwide. The programme offers industry-leading benefits, including free internet for members across IHG’s family of nine trusted hotel brands.
